popt4jlib.GradientDescent

Class OneDStepQuantumOptimizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.GradientDescent.OneDStepQuantumOptimizer

  • public final class OneDStepQuantumOptimizer
extends java.lang.Object
    the class implements a minimization method for a function alone one of its variables, using an initial starting point x0, and a quantum step-size that the variable must be constrained to take values on multiples of.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double argmin(FunctionIntf f, VectorIntf x0, java.util.Hashtable fparams, int varindex, double stepquantum, double lowerbound, double upperbound, int niterbnd, int multfactor, double ftol)
      computes a local minimum of the restriction of the function f in the j-th variable, under the box-constraints lowerbound <= x_j <= upperbound, and also under the constraint that x_j = x0_j + k*stepquantum where k is an integer quantity.
      private double detdir(FunctionIntf f, java.util.Hashtable params, VectorIntf x, int j, double eps, double lb, double ub, double ftol)
      determine in which direction (up or down) the function f decreases, along the j-th variable, or return zero.
      int getDir()
      if the return value is zero, it means that the optimization process did not produce a new result: the starting point was already (near-) minimal.

        if the return value is zero, it means that the optimization process did not produce a new result: the starting point was already (near-) minimal.

      • argmin

        public double argmin(FunctionIntf f,
            VectorIntf x0,
            java.util.Hashtable fparams,
            int varindex,
            double stepquantum,
            double lowerbound,
            double upperbound,
            int niterbnd,
            int multfactor,
            double ftol)
              throws OptimizerException,
                     ParallelException
        computes a local minimum of the restriction of the function f in the j-th variable, under the box-constraints lowerbound <= x_j <= upperbound, and also under the constraint that x_j = x0_j + k*stepquantum where k is an integer quantity.
        Parameters:
        f - FunctionIntf
        x0 - VectorIntf
        fparams - Hashtable
        varindex - int
        stepquantum - double
        lowerbound - double
        upperbound - double
        niterbnd - int how many iterations to proceed in the same direction before incrementing the current step-size
        multfactor - int the mult factor by which to multiply the current step-size after a number of iterations are all in the same direction
        ftol - double the function tolerance below which two function evals are considered the same
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        OptimizerException
        ParallelException

      • detdir

        private double detdir(FunctionIntf f,
            java.util.Hashtable params,
            VectorIntf x,
            int j,
            double eps,
            double lb,
            double ub,
            double ftol)
               throws ParallelException,
                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        determine in which direction (up or down) the function f decreases, along the j-th variable, or return zero.
        Parameters:
        f - FunctionIntf the function
        params - Hashtable parameters of the function
        x - VectorIntf the argument
        j - int the index of the variable in question (in {0,...n-1})
        eps - double
        lb - double
        ub - double
        ftol - double
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        ParallelException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
